data.title: US Representative Blaine Luetkemeyer
data.meta_description: US Representative Blaine Luetkemeyer - R United States
data.text: HR3507 Yes In My Backyard Act A BILL To require certain grantees under title I of the Housing and Community Development Act of 1974 to submit a plan to track discriminatory land use policies, and for other purposes. In Committee HR6785 Rural Housing Service Reform Act of 2023 A BILL To reform rural housing programs, and for other purposes. In Committee HRes1015 Expressing support for the designation of February 17 through February 24, 2024, as "National FFA Week", recognizing the important role of the National FFA Organization in developing the next generation of globally conscious leaders who will change the world, and celebrating the 10th anniversary of the "Give the Gift of Blue" program, which has donated more than 17,000 of the iconic FFA jackets to FFA members in need. Expressing support for the designation of February 17 through February 24, 2024, as "National FFA Week", recognizing the important role of the National FFA Organization in developing the next generation of globally conscious leaders who will change the world, and celebrating the 10th anniversary of the "Give the Gift of Blue" program, which has donated more than 17,000 of the iconic FFA jackets to FFA members in need. In Committee HJRes122 Providing for congressional disapproval under chapter 8 of title 5, United States Code, of the rule submitted by the Bureau of Consumer Financial Protection relating to "Credit Card Penalty Fees (Regulation Z)". Providing for congressional disapproval under chapter 8 of title 5, United States Code, of the rule submitted by the Bureau of Consumer Financial Protection relating to "Credit Card Penalty Fees (Regulation Z)". In Committee HJRes127 Providing for congressional disapproval under chapter 8 of title 5, United States Code, of the rule submitted by the Securities and Exchange Commission relating to "The Enhancement and Standardization of Climate-Related Disclosures for Investors". Providing for congressional disapproval under chapter 8 of title 5, United States Code, of the rule submitted by the Securities and Exchange Commission relating to "The Enhancement and Standardization of Climate-Related Disclosures for Investors". In Committee HR9162 PRC Risk Transparency Act A BILL To amend the securities laws to require certain disclosures and reports with respect to the exposure of issuers to China and the threat of sudden loss of market access between the United States and China, and for other purposes. In Committee HR4758 Accelerating Kids’ Access to Care Act A BILL To amend title XIX of the Social Security Act to streamline enrollment under the Medicaid program of certain providers across State lines, and for other purposes. In Committee HRes1369 Remembering the life of Corey Comperatore who passed away on Saturday, July 13, 2024. Remembering the life of Corey Comperatore who passed away on Saturday, July 13, 2024. In Committee HR4581 Maternal and Child Health Stillbirth Prevention Act of 2024 AN ACT To amend title V of the Social Security Act to support stillbirth prevention and research, and for other purposes. Signed/Enacted/Adopted HR2941 Recognizing the Role of Direct Support Professionals Act A BILL To require the Office of Management and Budget to revise the Standard Occupational Classification system to establish a separate code for direct support professionals, and for other purposes. In Committee HR4132 Falun Gong Protection Act AN ACT To provide for the imposition of sanctions with respect to forced organ harvesting within the People’s Republic of China, and for other purposes. Crossed Over HR2365 Dr. Emmanuel Bilirakis and Honorable Jennifer Wexton National Plan to End Parkinson’s Act AN ACT To direct the Secretary of Health and Human Services to carry out a national project to prevent, diagnose, treat, and cure Parkinson’s, to be known as the National Parkinson’s Project, and for other purposes. Signed/Enacted/Adopted HR8857 Conscience Protection Act of 2024 A BILL To amend the Public Health Service Act to prohibit discrimination against health care entities that do not participate in abortion, and to strengthen implementation and enforcement of Federal conscience laws. In Committee HR8847 Confronting CCP Human Rights Abusers Act A BILL To require the inclusion of the Ministry of Public Security’s Institute of Forensic Science of China on the entity list maintained by the Bureau of Industry and Security of the Department of Commerce, and for other purposes. In Committee HRes1303 Condemning the Biden administration's politically motivated ban on liquefied natural gas exports to non-free trade agreement countries. Condemning the Biden administration's politically motivated ban on liquefied natural gas exports to non-free trade agreement countries. In Committee HR537 Forgotten Heroes of the Holocaust Congressional Gold Medal Act AN ACT To award a Congressional Gold Medal to 60 diplomats, in recognition of their bravery and heroism during the Holocaust. Crossed Over HR8693 No American Land for Communist China Act A BILL To prohibit certain businesses and persons from purchasing real estate adjacent to covered Federal lands in the United States, and for other purposes. In Committee HR8683 To require the Secretary of Defense and the Secretary of State to monitor efforts by the People's Republic of China to build or buy strategic foreign ports, and for other purposes. A BILL To require the Secretary of Defense and the Secretary of State to monitor efforts by the People’s Republic of China to build or buy strategic foreign ports, and for other purposes. In Committee HJRes163 Providing for congressional disapproval under chapter 8 of title 5, United States Code, of the rule submitted by the Environmental Protection Agency relating to "New Source Performance Standards for Greenhouse Gas Emissions From New, Modified, and Reconstructed Fossil Fuel-Fired Electric Generating Units; Emission Guidelines for Greenhouse Gas Emissions From Existing Fossil Fuel-Fired Electric Generating Units; and Repeal of the Affordable Clean Energy Rule". Providing for congressional disapproval under chapter 8 of title 5, United States Code, of the rule submitted by the Environmental Protection Agency relating to "New Source Performance Standards for Greenhouse Gas Emissions From New, Modified, and Reconstructed Fossil Fuel-Fired Electric Generating Units; Emission Guidelines for Greenhouse Gas Emissions From Existing Fossil Fuel-Fired Electric Generating Units; and Repeal of the Affordable Clean Energy Rule". In Committee HR5403 CBDC Anti-Surveillance State Act AN ACT To amend the Federal Reserve Act to prohibit the Federal reserve banks from offering certain products or services directly to an individual, to prohibit the use of central bank digital currency for monetary policy, and for other purposes. Crossed Over HRes1252 Honoring the commitment and care of emergency medical services personnel. Honoring the commitment and care of emergency medical services personnel. In Committee HR807 Working Dog Commemorative Coin Act AN ACT To require the Secretary of the Treasury to mint coins in commemoration of the invaluable service that working dogs provide to society. Crossed Over HR3433 Give Kids a Chance Act of 2023 A BILL To amend the Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act with respect to molecularly targeted pediatric cancer investigations, and for other purposes. In Committee HR758 Promoting Access to Capital in Underbanked Communities Act of 2023 A BILL To require the appropriate Federal banking agencies to establish a 3-year phase-in period for de novo financial institutions to comply with Federal capital standards, to provide relief for de novo rural community banks, and for other purposes. In Committee HR8416 Drones for First Responders Act A BILL To amend the Harmonized Tariff Schedule of the United States to increase the rate of duty on unmanned aircraft, and for other purposes. In Committee HR8373 No Taxpayer-Funded Pensions for Sex Criminals Act A BILL To amend title 5, United States Code, to prohibit the payment of annuities and retired pay to individuals convicted of certain sex crimes, and for other purposes. In Committee HR8313 Help DPA Act Help Expedite Lagging Permitting for Defense Production Act A BILL To prioritize Federal permitting for certain national defense activities related to the authorities under the Defense Production Act of 1950 and projects related to such activities, and for other purposes. In Committee HRes1197 Recognizing the roles and contributions of elementary and secondary school teachers in building and enhancing the civic, cultural, and economic well-being of the United States. Recognizing the roles and contributions of elementary and secondary school teachers in building and enhancing the civic, cultural, and economic well-being of the United States. In Committee HR8231 James Earl Jones Congressional Gold Medal Act A BILL To award a congressional gold medal to James Earl Jones, an American icon, in recognition of a remarkable life in reshaping perceptions, dismantling racial barriers, and advocating for equal opportunities for people of all backgrounds in film and theatre. In Committee HR5333 Investing in All of America Act of 2023 AN ACT To amend the Small Business Investment Act of 1958 to exclude from the limit on leverage certain amounts invested in smaller enterprises located in rural or lowincome areas and small businesses in critical technology areas, and for other purposes. Crossed Over HR8061 Crime Victims Fund Stabilization Act of 2024 A BILL To temporarily provide additional deposits into the Crime Victims Fund. In Committee HR8040 To limit the closure or consolidation of any United States Postal Service processing and distribution center in Postal Service regions that have failed to meet certain delivery standards, and for other purposes. A BILL To limit the closure or consolidation of any United States Postal Service processing and distribution center in Postal Service regions that have failed to meet certain delivery standards, and for other purposes. In Committee HR8033 Regulatory Transparency for Small Businesses Act A BILL To amend title 5, United States Code, to clarify the information required to be included in a certification by an agency that a rule will not have a significant economic impact on a substantial number of small entities. In Committee HR7428 Earned Wage Access Consumer Protection Act A BILL To regulate the business of offering and providing earned wage access services to consumers, and for other purposes. In Committee HJRes120 Providing for congressional disapproval under chapter 8 of title 5, United States Code, of the rule submitted by the Financial Stability Oversight Council related to "Guidance on Nonbank Financial Company Determinations". Providing for congressional disapproval under chapter 8 of title 5, United States Code, of the rule submitted by the Financial Stability Oversight Council related to "Guidance on Nonbank Financial Company Determinations". In Committee HR6015 Iran Sanctions Accountability Act of 2023 AN ACT To require the President to prevent the abuse of financial sanctions exemptions by Iran, and for other purposes. Crossed Over HR5535 Insurance Data Protection Act A BILL To prohibit the Federal Insurance Office of the Department of the Treasury and other financial regulators from collecting data directly from an insurance company. In Committee HR5921 No U.S. Financing for Iran Act of 2023 AN ACT To prohibit the Secretary of the Treasury from authorizing certain transactions by a United States financial institution in connection with Iran, to prevent the International Monetary Fund from providing financial assistance to Iran, to codify prohibitions on Export-Import Bank financing for the Government of Iran, and for other purposes. Crossed Over HRes1148 Condemning the Iranian regime's terrorism, regional proxy war, internal suppression, and for other purposes. Condemning the Iranian regime's terrorism, regional proxy war, internal suppression, and for other purposes. In Committee HR7954 Fortifying U.S. Markets From Chinese Military Aggression Act A BILL To amend the Financial Stability Act of 2010 to establish an Advisory Committee on Economic Fallout From Chinese Military Aggression Towards Taiwan, and for other purposes. In Committee HR7963 Small Business Red Tape Relief Act of 2024 A BILL To amend title 31, United States Code, to require FinCEN to submit to Congress a quarterly report on certain beneficial ownership data. In Committee HR7932 Save Our Shrimpers Act A BILL To prohibit Federal funds from being made available to international financial institutions for the purposes of financing foreign shrimp farms, and for other purposes. In Committee HR7857 Accurate Credit Reporting for Homebuyers Act A BILL To require the Director of the Federal Housing Finance Agency to issue a rule to condition the purchase of a residential mortgage loan on the delivery of credit reports and credit scores from each consumer reporting agency that compiles and maintains files on consumers on a nationwide basis, and for other purposes. In Committee HR7770 Rosie the Riveter Commemorative Coin Act A BILL To require the Secretary of the Treasury to mint coins in commemoration of the women who contributed to the Home Front during World War II, and for other purposes. In Committee HRes1086 Expressing support for the designation of March 19, 2024, as "National Agriculture Day" and celebrating the importance of agriculture as one of the most impactful industries in the United States. Expressing support for the designation of March 19, 2024, as "National Agriculture Day" and celebrating the importance of agriculture as one of the most impactful industries in the United States. In Committee HRes1055 Congratulating the Kansas City Chiefs on their victory in Super Bowl LVIII. Congratulating the Kansas City Chiefs on their victory in Super Bowl LVIII. In Committee HR7531 Secure Payments Act of 2024 A BILL To require the Board of Governors of the Federal Reserve System to study the impacts of the Board’s Reg II proposed rule, to complete a quantitative impact analysis of such rule, and to consider the results of such study and analysis before finalizing such rule, and for other purposes. In Committee HR7500 To amend the Defense Production Act of 1950 to allow an Indian Tribe to request CFIUS review of certain transactions between the Indian Tribe and foreign persons, and for other purposes. A BILL To amend the Defense Production Act of 1950 to allow an Indian Tribe to request CFIUS review of certain transactions between the Indian Tribe and foreign persons, and for other purposes. In Committee HR5265 Small Business Administration Rural Performance Report Act AN ACT To amend the Small Business Act to require a report on the performance of the Office of Rural Affairs, to require a report on the memorandum of understanding between the Small Business Administration and the Department of Agriculture entered into on April 4, 2018, and for other purposes. Crossed Over HR7438 FIFA World Cup 2026 Commemorative Coin Act A BILL To require the Secretary of the Treasury to mint coins in commemoration of the FIFA World Cup 2026, and for other purposes. In Committee HR7129 Put America on Commission Act of 2024 A BILL To amend the Small Business Act to establish the Office of Whistleblower Awards, and for other purposes. In Committee HR7379 MATCH IT Act of 2024 Patient Matching And Transparency in Certified Health IT Act of 2024 A BILL To amend title XXX of the Public Health Service Act to establish standards and protocols to improve patient matching. In Committee HR7380 PURR Act of 2024 Pet Food Uniform Regulatory Reform Act of 2024 A BILL To amend the Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act to clarify and update the authority of the Food and Drug Administration to ensure national uniformity in the regulation of the marketing and labeling of companion animal pet food, and for other purposes. In Committee HRes966 Condemning rape and sexual violence committed by Hamas in its war against Israel. RESOLUTION Condemning rape and sexual violence committed by Hamas in its war against Israel. In Committee HR7297 Homebuyers Privacy Protection Act A BILL To amend the Fair Credit Reporting Act to prevent consumer reporting agencies from furnishing consumer reports under certain circumstances, and for other purposes. In Committee HR6951 College Cost Reduction Act A BILL To lower the cost of postsecondary education for students and families. In Committee HR7035 Death Tax Repeal Act A BILL To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to repeal the estate and generation-skipping transfer taxes. In Committee HR7019 Holding Foreign Insiders Accountable Act A BILL To amend the Securities Exchange Act of 1934 to address disclosures by directors, officers, and principal stockholders of foreign private issuers, and for other purposes. In Committee HR788 Stop Settlement Slush Funds Act of 2023 AN ACT To limit donations made pursuant to settlement agreements to which the United States is a party, and for other purposes. Crossed Over HR6962 Financial Stability Oversight Council Reform Act A BILL To place the Financial Stability Oversight Council and the Office of Financial Research under the regular appropriations process, to provide for certain quarterly reporting and public notice and comment requirements for the Office of Financial Research, and for other purposes. In Committee HRes955 Commending Taiwan for its history of democratic elections, and expressing support of Taiwan in the preservation of its democratic institutions. RESOLUTION Commending Taiwan for its history of democratic elections, and expressing support of Taiwan in the preservation of its democratic institutions. In Committee HR6789 Rectifying UDAAP Act Rectifying Undefined Descriptions of Abusive Acts and Practices Act A BILL To amend the Consumer Financial Protection Act of 2010 to clarify standards for UDAAP enforcement actions brought by the Bureau of Consumer Financial Protection, and for other purposes. In Committee HR6760 No Tax Dollars for the United Nations Climate Agenda Act A BILL To prohibit United States contributions to the Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change, the United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change, and the Green Climate Fund. In Committee HR6769 Trusted Foreign Auditing Act of 2023 A BILL To amend the Sarbanes-Oxley Act of 2002 to provide for disclosure regarding foreign jurisdictions that hinder inspections, and for other purposes. In Committee HR6726 Responsible Accounting Standards Act of 2023 A BILL To amend the Securities Act of 1933 to require the accounting principles standard setting body to comply with the Administrative Procedure Act and the Government in the Sunshine Act, to require the head of such body to testify annually before Congress, and for other purposes. In Committee HJRes66 Disapproving the rule submitted by the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau relating to "Small Business Lending Under the Equal Credit Opportunity Act (Regulation B)". JOINT RESOLUTION Disapproving the rule submitted by the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau relating to ‘‘Small Business Lending Under the Equal Credit Opportunity Act (Regulation B)’’. In Committee HR5945 Freezing HAMAS Act Freezing and Halting Any More Alleviation of Sanctions Act A BILL To reinstate certain sanctions imposed with respect to Iran. In Committee HR6000 Revoke Iranian Funding Act of 2023 A BILL To freeze $6,000,000,000 of Iranian funds held in Qatar, and for other purposes. In Committee HR3774 SHIP Act Stop Harboring Iranian Petroleum Act AN ACT To impose additional sanctions with respect to the importation or facilitation of the importation of petroleum products from Iran, and for other purposes. Crossed Over HR6175 NO GOTION Act No Official Giveaways Of Taxpayers’ Income to Oppressive Nations Act A BILL To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to deny certain green energy tax benefits to companies connected to certain countries of concern. In Committee HRes768 Standing with Israel as it defends itself against the barbaric war launched by Hamas and other terrorists. RESOLUTION Standing with Israel as it defends itself against the barbaric war launched by Hamas and other terrorists. In Committee HCRes74 Expressing support for the Geneva Consensus Declaration on Promoting Women's Health and Strengthening the Family and urging that the United States rejoin this historic declaration. CONCURRENT RESOLUTION Expressing support for the Geneva Consensus Declaration on Promoting Women’s Health and Strengthening the Family and urging that the United States rejoin this historic declaration. In Committee HRes771 Standing with Israel as it defends itself against the barbaric war launched by Hamas and other terrorists. RESOLUTION Standing with Israel as it defends itself against the barbaric war launched by Hamas and other terrorists. In Committee HR5830 American Genetic Privacy Act of 2023 A BILL To prohibit commercial DNA testing services from disclosing the genetic information of United States nationals to foreign entities, and for other purposes. In Committee HR5837 Protecting America's Property Rights Act A BILL To provide additional requirements for the purchase and sale of conventional mortgages by the enterprises, and for other purposes. In Committee HR5849 Mobile Mammography Promotion Act of 2023 A BILL To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to allow refunds of Federal motor fuel excise taxes on fuels used in mobile mammography vehicles. In Committee HR5848 To prohibit the Administrator of the Small Business Administration from directly making loans under the 7(a) loan program, and for other purposes. A BILL To prohibit the Administrator of the Small Business Administration from directly making loans under the 7(a) loan program, and for other purposes. In Committee HR5424 Main Street Competes Act A BILL To amend the Small Business Economic Policy Act of 1980 to examine how the competitiveness of small businesses is affected by the enforcement of Federal antitrust laws, and for other purposes. In Committee HR5409 Safeguarding American Farms from Foreign Influence Act A BILL To amend the Defense Production Act of 1950 to require the Committee on Foreign Investment in the United States to determine whether a national security review is needed for reportable agricultural land transactions referred by the Secretary of Agriculture, and for other purposes. In Committee HR4428 Guidance Clarity Act of 2023 A BILL To require a guidance clarity statement on certain agency guidance, and for other purposes. In Committee HR760 Chinese Military and Surveillance Company Sanctions Act of 2023 A BILL To impose sanctions with respect to Communist Chinese military and surveillance companies. In Committee HR5030 Secure Rural Schools Reauthorization Act of 2023 A BILL To extend the Secure Rural Schools and Community Self- Determination Act of 2000. In Committee HR5465 Congressional Access to Bureaucratic Offices Act A BILL To require the head of each agency to allow members of Congress access to certain Federal buildings, and for other purposes. In Committee HR5475 Prohibiting Adversarial Patents Act of 2023 A BILL To amend title 35, United State Code, to require the Director of the United States Patent and Trademark Office to require disclosures in patent applications regarding ties to the People’s Republic of China and other foreign adversaries, and for other purposes. In Committee HR5488 Protecting Our Courts from Foreign Manipulation Act of 2023 A BILL To amend chapter 111 of title 28, United States Code, to increase transparency and oversight of third-party funding by foreign persons, to prohibit third-party funding by foreign states and sovereign wealth funds, and for other purposes. In Committee HR3152 Fight and Combat Rampant Iranian Missile Exports Act Fight CRIME Act AN ACT To impose sanctions with respect to countries, individuals, and entities that engage in any effort to acquire, possess, develop, transport, transfer, or deploy Iranian missiles and related goods and technology, including materials and equipment, and for other purposes. Crossed Over HR3995 Small Business Regulatory Reduction Act A BILL To require the Administrator of the Small Business Administration to ensure that the small business regulatory budget for a fiscal year is not greater than zero, and for other purposes. In Committee HRes668 BUDS Resolution Building Unity through Dual Sponsors Resolution joint resolution in the House of Representatives if one of the Members is from the majority party and the other is from the minority party. IN THE HOUSE OF REPRESENTATIVES SEPTEMBER 1, 2023 Mr. CLEAVER (for himself, Mrs. KIM of California, Mr. KILMER, Mr. TIMMONS, Mr. PHILLIPS, and Mr. CAREY) submitted the following resolution; which was referred to the Committee on Rules RESOLUTION Authorizing two Members to serve as joint sponsors of a bill, resolution, or joint resolution in the House of Representatives if one of the Members is from the majority party and the other is from the minority party. In Committee HR5076 Prevent Discrimination in Title X Act A BILL To clarify that, in awarding funding under title X of the Public Health Service Act, the Secretary of Health and Human Services may not discriminate against eligible States, individuals, or other entities for refusing to counsel or refer for abortions. In Committee HR4974 Local 9–8–8 Response Act of 2023 A BILL To amend the Communications Act of 1934 to improve the accessibility of 9-8-8, and for other purposes. In Committee HR4993 To amend title 46, United States Code, to include the replacement or purchase of additional cargo handling equipment as an eligible purpose for Capital Construction Funds, and for other purposes. A BILL To amend title 46, United States Code, to include the replacement or purchase of additional cargo handling equipment as an eligible purpose for Capital Construction Funds, and for other purposes. In Committee HRes627 Condemning the Government of the Islamic Republic of Iran for the massacre of political prisoners in 1988 and the uprisings of recent years, including the 2018, 2019, and 2022 uprisings, and calling for justice for its victims. RESOLUTION Condemning the Government of the Islamic Republic of Iran for the massacre of political prisoners in 1988 and the uprisings of recent years, including the 2018, 2019, and 2022 uprisings, and calling for justice for its victims. In Committee HR4942 Conrad State 30 and Physician Access Reauthorization Act A BILL To provide incentives to physicians to practice in rural and medically underserved communities, and for other purposes. In Committee HR1096 250th Anniversary of the United States Marine Corps Commemorative Coin Act AN ACT To require the Secretary of the Treasury to mint coins in commemoration of the 250th Anniversary of the United States Marine Corps, and to support programs at the Marine Corps Heritage Center. Signed/Enacted/Adopted HR3203 Stop Chinese Fentanyl Act of 2023 AN ACT To impose sanctions with respect to Chinese producers of synthetic opioids and opioid precursors, to hold Chinese officials accountable for the spread of illicit fentanyl, and for other purposes. Crossed Over HR3244 Stop Fentanyl Money Laundering Act of 2023 A BILL To provide authority to the Secretary of the Treasury to take special measures against certain entities outside of the United States of primary money laundering concern in connection with illicit fentanyl and narcotics financing, and for other purposes. In Committee HR4879 Holding Chinese Listed Companies Accountable Act A BILL To amend the Sarbanes-Oxley Act of 2002 to specify that the trading prohibition for certain Chinese issuers that retain public accounting firms that have not been subject to inspection by the Public Company Accounting Oversight Board shall apply after 1 year, and for other purposes. In Committee HRes612 Acknowledging the service, sacrifice, and courage of veterans and ensuring that Congress imposes no additional fee or cost for benefits earned through service. RESOLUTION Acknowledging the service, sacrifice, and courage of veterans and ensuring that Congress imposes no additional fee or cost for benefits earned through service. In Committee HR4157 Not Just a Number Act A BILL To require the Secretary of Veterans Affairs to prepare an annual report on suicide prevention, and for other purposes. In Committee HR592 Department of Veterans Affairs Electronic Health Record Modernization Improvement Act A BILL To prohibit the Secretary of Veterans Affairs from carrying out certain activities under the Electronic Health Record Modernization Program until certification of system improvements and facility readiness. In Committee HR1282 Major Richard Star Act A BILL To amend title 10, United States Code, to expand eligibility to certain military retirees for concurrent receipt of veterans’ disability compensation and retired pay or combatrelated special compensation, and for other purposes. In Committee HR4721 Main Street Tax Certainty Act A BILL To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to make permanent the deduction for qualified business income. In Committee HR3952 To limit the flags that may be flown over a facility of the Department of Veterans Affairs. A BILL To limit the flags that may be flown over a facility of the Department of Veterans Affairs. In Committee HR4417 Ending Agricultural Trade Suppression Act A BILL To prevent States and local jurisdictions from interfering with the production and distribution of agricultural products in interstate commerce, and for other purposes. In Committee HR4362 Saving Organs One Flight at a Time Act A BILL To require the Administrator of the Transportation Security Administration and the Administrator of the Federal Aviation Administration to jointly issue regulations relating to air carrier transport of human organs, and for other purposes. In Committee HR4335 VA Loan Informed Disclosure Act of 2023 A BILL To amend the National Housing Act to include information regarding VA home loans in the Informed Consumer Choice Disclosure required to be provided to prospective FHA borrowers. In Committee HR4346 Small Bank Holding Company Relief Act of 2023 A BILL To raise the consolidated assets threshold under the small bank holding company policy statement, and for other purposes. In Committee HR4341 Ukraine Reconstruction Accountability and Transparency Act A BILL To direct the United States Executive Directors at the international financial institutions to use voice, vote, and influence of the United States to prevent companies from countries that actively or tacitly supported the Russian invasion of Ukraine from benefitting from its reconstruction, and for other purposes. In Committee HJRes44 Providing for congressional disapproval under chapter 8 of title 5, United States Code, of the rule submitted by the Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco, Firearms, and Explosives relating to "Factoring Criteria for Firearms with Attached 'Stabilizing Braces'". JOINT RESOLUTION Providing for congressional disapproval under chapter 8 of title 5, United States Code, of the rule submitted by the Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco, Firearms, and Explosives relating to ‘‘Factoring Criteria for Firearms with Attached ‘Stabilizing Braces’ ’’. Crossed Over HR4252 Protecting Education Privacy Act A BILL To clarify the requirements of authorized representatives under the Family Educational Rights and Privacy Act of 1974, and for other purposes. In Committee HR277 Regulations from the Executive in Need of Scrutiny Act of 2023 AN ACT To amend chapter 8 of title 5, United States Code, to provide that major rules of the executive branch shall have no force or effect unless a joint resolution of approval is enacted into law. Crossed Over HR4198 Protecting Consumers from Abusive Mortgage Leads Act A BILL To amend section 604(c) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act to address the treatment of pre-screening report requests, and for other purposes. In Committee HR4189 CONNECT for Health Act of 2023 Creating Opportunities Now for Necessary and Effective Care Technologies for Health Act of 2023 A BILL To amend title XVIII of the Social Security Act to expand access to telehealth services, and for other purposes. In Committee HR4035 Protecting Small Business Information Act of 2023 A BILL To require the Secretary of the Treasury to harmonize the effective dates of all rules required under the Corporate Transparency Act, and for other purposes. In Committee HR4036 Accountability through Confirmation Act A BILL To amend title 31, United States Code, to require the Director of the Financial Crimes Enforcement Network to be appointed by the President and confirmed by the Senate, and for other purposes. In Committee HR3826 USS Frank E. Evans Act A BILL To provide for the inclusion on the Vietnam Veterans Memorial Wall of the names of the lost crew members of the USS Frank E. Evans killed on June 3, 1969. In Committee HR3875 Expanded Telehealth Access Act A BILL To amend title XVIII of the Social Security Act to expand the scope of practitioners eligible for payment for telehealth services under the Medicare program, and for other purposes. In Committee HR1644 7(a) Loan Agent Oversight Act A BILL To amend the Small Business Act to require a report on 7(a) agents, and for other purposes. In Committee HR1730 Supporting Small Business and Career and Technical Education Act of 2023 A BILL To amend the Small Business Act to include requirements relating to graduates of career and technical education programs or programs of study for small business development centers and women’s business centers, and for other purposes. In Committee HR3702 Access Technology Affordability Act of 2023 A BILL To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to allow a refundable tax credit against income tax for the purchase of qualified access technology for the blind. In Committee HR3413 AM Radio for Every Vehicle Act of 2023 A BILL To require the Secretary of Transportation to issue a rule requiring access to AM broadcast stations in motor vehicles, and for other purposes. In Committee HR3464 Affordable Homeownership Access Act A BILL To exempt small seller financers from certain licensing requirements. In Committee HR3381 National Law Enforcement Officers Remembrance, Support and Community Outreach Act A BILL To authorize the Attorney General to establish the National Law Enforcement Officers Remembrance, Support and Community Outreach program, and for other purposes. In Committee HR3243 Small Business Stability Act A BILL To amend the Federal Deposit Insurance Act to allow the Board of Directors of the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation to guarantee noninterest-bearing transaction accounts for a certain period, and for other purposes. In Committee HR3242 To amend the Federal Reserve Act to establish a permanent Bank Term Funding Program to provide member banks and other depository institutions with short-term liquidity against long-term assets. A BILL To amend the Federal Reserve Act to establish a permanent Bank Term Funding Program to provide member banks and other depository institutions with short-term liquidity against long-term assets. In Committee HR1758 SIFT Act of 2023 Stopping Illicit Fentanyl Trafficking Act of 2023 A BILL To amend the Controlled Substances Act to list fentanylrelated substances as schedule I controlled substances. In Committee HRes362 Recognizing the roles and contributions of elementary and secondary school teachers in building and enhancing the civic, cultural, and economic well-being of the United States. RESOLUTION Recognizing the roles and contributions of elementary and secondary school teachers in building and enhancing the civic, cultural, and economic well-being of the United States. In Committee HR2891 SAFE Banking Act of 2023 Secure And Fair Enforcement Banking Act of 2023 A BILL To create protections for financial institutions that provide financial services to State-sanctioned marijuana businesses and service providers for such businesses, and for other purposes. In Committee HR2895 Time Is Up Act of 2023 A BILL To require the President to announce whether action will be taken with respect to a covered transaction under the Defense Production Act of 1950 that has passed the CFIUS transaction review deadline, and for other purposes. In Committee HR3014 CART Act of 2023 Catastrophic Risk Transfer Act of 2023 A BILL To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to establish a system for the taxation of catastrophic risk transfer companies to ensure sufficient capital to cover catastrophic insurance losses, and for other purposes. In Committee HR2923 Living Donor Protection Act of 2023 A BILL To promote and protect from discrimination living organ donors. In Committee HR2826 Save Local Business Act A BILL To clarify the treatment of 2 or more employers as joint employers under the National Labor Relations Act and the Fair Labor Standards Act of 1938. In Committee HR2673 American Innovation and R&D Competitiveness Act of 2023 A BILL To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to restore the deduction for research and experimental expenditures. In Committee HR2743 Fair Access to Banking Act A BILL To amend the Federal Reserve Act to prohibit certain financial service providers who deny fair access to financial services from using taxpayer funded discount window lending programs, and for other purposes. In Committee HJRes27 Providing for congressional disapproval under chapter 8 of title 5, United States Code, of the rule submitted by the Department of the Army, Corps of Engineers, Department of Defense and the Environmental Protection Agency relating to "Revised Definition of 'Waters of the United States'". Joint Resolution Providing for congressional disapproval under chapter 8 of title 5, United States Code, of the rule submitted by the Department of the Army, Corps of Engineers, Department of Defense and the Environmental Protection Agency relating to ‘‘Revised Definition of ‘Waters of the United States’ ’’. Vetoed HR2474 Strengthening Medicare for Patients and Providers Act A BILL To amend title XVIII of the Social Security Act to provide for an update to a single conversion factor under the Medicare physician fee schedule that is based on the Medicare economic index. In Committee HR2630 Safe Step Act A BILL To amend the Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974 to require a group health plan or health insurance coverage offered in connection with such a plan to provide an exceptions process for any medication step therapy protocol, and for other purposes. In Committee HR2603 To require the Securities and Exchange Commission to revise certain thresholds related to smaller reporting companies, accelerated filers, and large accelerated filers, and for other purposes. A BILL To require the Securities and Exchange Commission to revise certain thresholds related to smaller reporting companies, accelerated filers, and large accelerated filers, and for other purposes. In Committee HR2539 New Markets Tax Credit Extension Act of 2023 A BILL To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to permanently extend the new markets tax credit, and for other purposes. In Committee HJRes50 Providing for congressional disapproval under chapter 8 of title 5, United States Code, of the rule submitted by the Bureau of Consumer Financial Protection relating to "Small Business Lending Under the Equal Credit Opportunity Act (Regulation B)". In Committee HR2433 Fairness for Rural Teaching Hospitals Act of 2023 A BILL To amend title XVIII of the Social Security Act to update the calculation of the hospital specific rate for such hospitals, and for other purposes. In Committee HR2440 Covenant School Heroes Congressional Gold Medal Act an active shooter at the Covenant School in Nashville, Tennessee. IN THE HOUSE OF REPRESENTATIVES MARCH 30, 2023 Mr. OGLES (for himself, Mr. GREEN of Tennessee, Mr. BURCHETT, Mr. FLEISCHMANN, Ms. GREENE of Georgia, Mr. GOODEN of Texas, Mr. SELF, Mr. NEHLS, Mrs. BOEBERT, Mr. MILLS, Mr. OWENS, Mr. GUEST, and Mr. BURLISON) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Financial Services A BILL To award Congressional Gold Medals to Metropolitan Police Officers Officer Michael Collazo and Officer Rex Englebert, in recognition of their exceptional bravery and valor in confronting an active shooter at the Covenant School in Nashville, Tennessee. In Committee HR1139 GUARD VA Benefits Act Governing Unaccredited Representatives Defrauding VA Benefits Act A BILL To amend title 38, United States Code, to reinstate penalties for persons charging veterans unauthorized fees relating to claims for benefits under the laws administered by the Secretary of Veterans Affairs, and for other purposes. In Committee HR1810 Bank Loan Privacy Act A BILL To require the Bureau of Consumer Financial Protection to issue a rule before deleting or modifying certain small business loan data, and for other purposes. In Committee HR1806 Small LENDER Act Small Lenders Exempt from New Data and Excessive Reporting Act A BILL To amend the Equal Credit Opportunity Act to modify the requirements associated with small business loan data collection, and for other purposes. In Committee HR1817 Preventing Racial Profiling in Lending Act A BILL To prohibit Federal agencies from requiring lenders to estimate a borrower’s race or ethnicity via visual observation or surname. In Committee HR1610 Chiropractic Medicare Coverage Modernization Act of 2023 A BILL To amend title XVIII of the Social Security Act to provide Medicare coverage for all physicians’ services furnished by doctors of chiropractic within the scope of their license, and for other purposes. In Committee HR1608 Consumer and Fuel Retailer Choice Act of 2023 A BILL To amend the Clean Air Act with respect to the ethanol waiver for Reid Vapor Pressure under that Act, and for other purposes. In Committee HR1787 Carnivals are Real Entertainment Act A BILL To amend the Immigration and Nationality Act to provide nonimmigrant status to mobile entertainment workers, and for other purposes. In Committee HJRes30 Providing for congressional disapproval under chapter 8 of title 5, United States Code, of the rule submitted by the Department of Labor relating to "Prudence and Loyalty in Selecting Plan Investments and Exercising Shareholder Rights". Joint Resolution Providing for congressional disapproval under chapter 8 of title 5, United States Code, of the rule submitted by the Department of Labor relating to ‘‘Prudence and Loyalty in Selecting Plan Investments and Exercising Shareholder Rights’’. Vetoed HR1733 Kids in Classes Act A BILL To establish an alternative use of certain Federal education funds when in-person instruction is not available. CONCURRENT RESOLUTION Expressing the sense of Congress that tax-exempt fraternal benefit societies have historically provided and continue to provide critical benefits to the people and communities of the United States. In Committee HR1582 PHIT Act of 2023 Personal Health Investment Today Act of 2023 A BILL To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to treat certain amounts paid for physical activity, fitness, and exercise as amounts paid for medical care. In Committee HR1572 Hello Girls Congressional Gold Medal Act of 2023 A BILL To award a Congressional Gold Medal to the female telephone operators of the Army Signal Corps, known as the ‘‘Hello Girls’’. In Committee HR1411 CFPB–IG Reform Act of 2023 Bureau of Consumer Financial Protection-Inspector General Reform Act of 2023 A BILL To require Senate confirmation of Inspector General of the Bureau of Consumer Financial Protection, and for other purposes. In Committee HR1379 Access to Small Business Investor Capital Act A BILL To permit a registered investment company to omit certain fees from the calculation of Acquired Fund Fees and Expenses, and for other purposes. In Committee HR1410 Consumer Financial Protection Commission Act A BILL To amend the Consumer Financial Protection Act of 2010 to make the Bureau of Consumer Financial Protection an independent Consumer Financial Protection Commission, and for other purposes. In Committee HRes147 Expressing support for the designation of February 18 through February 25, 2023, as "National FFA Week", recognizing the important role of the National FFA Organization in developing the next generation of globally conscious leaders who will change the world, and celebrating the 90th anniversary of the iconic FFA jacket. RESOLUTION Expressing support for the designation of February through February 25, 2023, as ‘‘National FFA Week’’, recognizing the important role of the National FFA Organization in developing the next generation of globally conscious leaders who will change the world, and celebrating the 90th anniversary of the iconic FFA jacket. In Committee HR1307 To repeal the mandatory flood insurance coverage requirement for commercial properties located in flood hazard areas, and for other purposes. A BILL To repeal the mandatory flood insurance coverage requirement for commercial properties located in flood hazard areas, and for other purposes. A BILL To require the use of replacement cost value in determining the premium rates for flood insurance coverage under the National Flood Insurance Act, and for other purposes. In Committee HR1277 Military Spouse Hiring Act A BILL To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to make employers of spouses of military personnel eligible for the work opportunity credit. In Committee HR1306 Taxpayer Exposure Mitigation Act A BILL To provide for greater transfer of risk under the National Flood Insurance Program to private capital and reinsurance markets, and for other purposes. In Committee HR1250 Family Farm and Small Business Exemption Act A BILL To restore the exemption of family farms and small businesses from the definition of assets under title IV of the Higher Education Act of 1965. In Committee HR1059 Securing and Enabling Commerce Using Remote and Electronic Notarization Act of 2023 SECURE Notarization Act of 2023 AN ACT To authorize notaries public to perform, and to establish minimum standards for, electronic notarizations and remote notarizations that occur in or affect interstate commerce, to require any Federal court to recognize notarizations performed by a notarial officer of any State, to require any State to recognize notarizations performed by a notarial officer of any other State when the notarization was performed under or relates to a public Act, record, or judicial proceeding of the notarial officer’s State or when the notarization occurs in or affects interstate commerce, and for other purposes. Crossed Over HRes173 Expressing support for the designation of the week of February 27 through March 3, 2023, as "Public Schools Week". RESOLUTION Expressing support for the designation of the week of February 27 through March 3, 2023, as ‘‘Public Schools Week’’. In Committee HR1214 Net Price Calculator Improvement Act A BILL To amend the Higher Education Act of 1965 to make technical improvements to the Net Price Calculator system so that prospective students may have a more accurate understanding of the true cost of college. In Committee HRes134 Congratulating the Kansas City Chiefs on their victory in Super Bowl LVII. RESOLUTION Congratulating the Kansas City Chiefs on their victory in Super Bowl LVII. In Committee HR1015 Dustoff Crews of the Vietnam War Congressional Gold Medal Act A BILL To award a Congressional Gold Medal to the United States Army Dustoff crews of the Vietnam War, collectively, in recognition of their extraordinary heroism and lifesaving actions in Vietnam. In Committee HR987 Prime Minister Golda Meir Commemorative Coin Act A BILL To require the Secretary of the Treasury to mint coins in recognition of the late Prime Minister Golda Meir and the 75th anniversary of the United States-Israel relationship.
